text: Saw it slipped into the top 50 heres before rating. Had at brewey good, though some of these are hard to differentiate seems to lack some zip at the end.

12 oz bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, tart lemon citrus, mild spices, cloves, light banana, this is pretty good for the style, but not something that I would go after often.
Sample from the brewery. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of banana, fruity esters, bread. Taste is sweet with a light tang. Well done to style.

Tap. Fluffy white head, hazy bright lemon yellow. Nice clean banana, hay, and slight grassy twang in the aroma. Fruity, banana, hay, grass, but missing the citrusy burst I enjoy in the style. Light but firm and tightened carbonation.
this summer beer was quite nice as both a spicy wheat beer or hot weather quencher. soft body and feel, clove, banana and good wheat flavors all come through. nice."

Bottle:
Pours clear gold with a giant white head.
Lemon, wheat malt aroma.
Taste is a sharp, citrus, strong lemon, wheat...acidic.
Sharp, very crisp.

Wife ordered this daft at Victory brewpub, I snageed a few sips. Served in a Weisen glass, hazy light amber golden color with white head. Aroma of sweet pale malt, wheat, light banana/clove yeast note and some citrus. Taste adds some grass and a light earthiness to the aroma notes. Light body, moderate carbonation, dry, soft with slight bitter note on finish. Well done.
On tap at brewpub. Pours pale gold with thin white head. Wheat, banana, cloves. Lightly bitter and sweet. Watery body with light carbonation.

Pours clear straw with an orange hue and big creamy white frothy head. Aroma brings some nice yeast gassy funk and sweet golden malts. Flavor brings refreshing clean crispy wheat like malts with a balanced crisp body. ABV is now 4.3 not as advertised on the site.

Pours a translucent gold on tap with fluffy white head that doesnt really stick on the way down. Aroma of german esters and wheat, slight citrus, taste follows minus the citrus. Bubbly and dry, easy to drink, but not a great example of the style.
On rap at dalias. Mostly clear pour white head. Aroma of wheat dry earth and vanilla. Similar taste finishes dry.
Sample at Buckeye Beer Engine on 9/11/12. Clear yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove and light berry. Banana and clove flavor with a sweet finish. Not really my thing.
tap.    notes of softed toast, creamed wheat,    touch of vanilla.  soft herbs.     touch of overripened pear.   pretty good, but not as good as weihenstephenaoisf  or ayigiger hefeweizen IMHO

least transparent, least effervescent of three, longest lasting spotty white head+ring. Nose more wheat than mad king, less banana and more bubblegum esters. Flavor highlights wheat more, more simple but less sugar, dryer across mid before light grain and fruit finish, even field-like, soft and creamy texture highlights malt better than mad king. And I dont even like wheat beers.Whirlwind v. Mad King v. Sunrise all on tap at brewery go:1. Sunrise2. Mad King3. Whirlwind

Surprised I havent rated this as Ive enjoyed it from the brewpub many times, still reviewing this from memory though.  Pours a fairly hazy straw gold with a fluffy white head.  Color is a touch darker and hazier than the Whirlwind.  Nose is aromatic esters, dry earthy yeast, light citrus, fresh wheat grains.  Mouth is wonderfully fluffy and soft, noticeably more so than Whirlwind or Mad King.  Light esters, fresh cracked grains, a really good yeast strain on the finish where soil, grass, and other dry flavors shine.  Unfiltered, more complex and interesting than Whirlwind.  Softer and way less hop-forward than Mad King.  Fresh on tap this is wonderful stuff.
Floral, banana, wheat with some lemon citrus. That about sums it up the flavor and aroma. Fairly fizzy makes it feel somewhat soda like.

color is straw gold, not as hazy as most, aroma of banana. clove, wheat, and coriander, taste of banana, clove, wheat, and bitter orange, high carbonation makes for an champagne feel, very good representation of the style

pours hazy straw, two finger off white head. Banana, clove, grass and herbal notes on the nose. Lemon, yeast, wheat, sweet malts. reminiscent of Franziskaner. higher carbonation, crisp, refreshing and solid for the style.

Reviewed from notes (2007).

A: Hazy yellow with a moderate white head.

S: Citrus, wheat and banana power forward

T: Lemon-Wheat standard for a hefeweizen with a hint of spice that adds some charm

M: Light and smooth.. goes down clean

O: Refreshing and drinkable when the weather is mild/warm
Bottle. Pours golden with a thick white head.  There is a lot of carbonation in this beer.  Smells floral. Tastes like a light wheat with a belgian flair.  This isnt my favorite style but I like it.

On draft, poured a cloudy orange with a decent fluffy whit head.  Aromas of banana, clove, and a touch of wheat.  Flavor has orange, clove, some spice, and wheat.  A nice beer to enjoy while cooking out.
A light gold color, smooth with a clean finish. Not a strong over powering taste. Cost is on the high side.

MMmmmm goood beer. Served with a nice, thick, foamy, frothy off white head that lasts a while and good lacing. Color is an almost clear yellow amber and lots of bubble trails. Aroma is a divine blend of malt, banana, spices, bubblegum, yeast. Flavor is classic Bavarian Weisse - malt, citrus, yeast, bit of sweet tart. Body is very good although still a little soft and great carbonation. Finish is like flavor, of good length, clean and slow taper. Very good, session beer.
Bright yellow color with a tall white head.  Mostly a piney citrus aroma.  Taste is slightly bitter with a chewy mouthfeel.  Finishes crisp and clean.  Very light and refreshing!

Aroma of light clover, hay, lemon and bubblegum. Appearance is well carbonated cloudy gold with white head. Flavor has mostly bubblegum and lemon up front, with a touch of clover in the finish. Palate is veru bubbly and tingly on the tongue. Very nice for the style.

pours hazy yellow with a lasting creamy white head and some lacing. aroma is fresh citrus, floral notes, and yeast.  body is a little lite but not bad. taste is lemon peel, banana, coriander, and yeast.  finish is sweet an a bit peppery.

A: The beer pours a hazy light golden orange color with a finger of white head.

S: Starts off with a nice aroma of clove and white pepper. There is a touch of nutmeg along with the sweet banana notes. Fairly sweet with some wheat, bread, and a fair amount of bubblegum.

T: The flavor has quite a bit of bubblegum to it along with a nice banana note. The clove flavor is a bit more subdued than I had hoped, but it is there, particularly on the finish. A bit too carbonated, unfortunately, which kills a bit of the malt flavor.

M: Light in body with a medium to high carbonation and a really crisp feeling on the tongue.

O: An easy to drink hefeweizen (as they should be). Could have used a bit more yeast contribution to it, but still alright.
Excellent hefe.  Almost as good as Paulaner, but not quite.  This style is one of my favorites, and this beer is one of the best.   Excellent on a hot summer day.
12 oz. bottle in a shaker.  Highly carbonated golden pour with heavy white head.  Crisp lemon aroma.  Has a nice bite for a hefeweizen.  Very smooth and refreshing.

12 oz bottle given to me by AirforceHops. Poured hazy honey yellow with a thick bubbly white head that diminished to a thin layer. Nose is of honey, citrus, wheat and spice. Makes my mouth water just looking at it.  Hard to see the carbonation in the glass but the bubbles you do see are active. Taste is banana, lots of spice, lemon with lots of wheat in the finish. The carbonation leaves your mouth tingly leaving your belly full. Reminds me sort of champagne.  Its a nice brew.  Thanks AirForceHops.

Bottle from Harvards in Augusta. Pours cloudy dark golden color with white head. Aromas of wheat, lemon, banana and clove. Wheat and banan flavors with a hint of lemony tartness and some clove. Light to medium body with lively carbonation. Crisp and refreshing. A decent hefe.
On tap at Zenos. Hazy light gold with thin white head. Aroma is lemongrass. Flavor is lemongrass with a touch of funk. Delicious.
Hazy gold pour, not much head.  Flavor is wheat and some banana, very small bite from the carbonation at the end.  All around a good wheat beer.
Great banana and clove flavors you come to expect from a unfiltered German style beer. Just a little low on carbonation, and its a little watery. Im really liking the grain bill, very fresh

18 July 2011, tap at the brewery. pale yellow and faintly whitish. nose is more of a coriander weisbier than banana. med body and faintly fizzy. slight banana w/ light coriander. nice but very soft and delicate for a weizen.
12oz bottle. very ligh gold, fluffy white head. light citrus aroma, lemons, grass. bright taste, crisp. yeast. nice hot summer beer.

Bottle. 12 oz. Pours light hay yellow with a fluffy, frothy white head. Leaves a flat surface after awhile. Aroma of lemon, saltine crackers, soft lavender and honey, and slight notes of must and cotton candy. Very odd nose. Medium to light bodied with a slightly hefty, yet roomy and soft palate. Very tangy, tart, and crisp citrus and sugary fruit hop flavors abound. Smooth, clean, quick finish. Very good thirst quencher, indeed.
Cloudy yellow with white head. The aroma is faint lemons, banana, and clove. Not much to it. Flavor is a bit sour with lemons mostly and some bread and bananas. Overall this was ok.

I think theres a bit of halo effect going on here. Pours slighty amber from tap. Its not nearly as cloudy as most hefes Ive encountered. The Banaba and clove on the nose is subdued. It lays fairly flat on the tongue. This one isnt doing much for me.

Pours almost a clear gold, minimal hazyness, with white head. Aroma was clove, citrus and wheat.  Taste was sweet and a little spicey.  Nice crisp finish to this weiss, it is perfecy for a hot summer day.

Thanks to Leafs93 for this one.  Pours a golden yellow color with a white foam head.  Aroma of candy sugar, banana, and clove.  Has a sweet malty taste with notes of banana and clove.  Not as crisp as I would like from a weiss.

Victory really makes some quality brews. This one is no exception.  Great fruity flavor, grassy hops, and small/light bitterness.  Well balanced, has some earthy notes in the taste/texture.  Probably one of the best hefes out there.

Bottle. Pour is straw yellow with a massive white head which leaves excellent lacing/retention. Aroma is banana, clove, lemon, fruity esthers. Flavor is yeasty, sweet, fruity. Palate is light, creamy, fizzy carbonation. Very crisp and refreshing.
Pours a hazy, pale orange gold with a white, rapidly receding head.  Lemon, clove, banana aroma.  Flavor is slightly sweet, but crisp, mildly spicy and with some citrus tang.  Tasty and refreshing.
Bottle from Cavie.  Murky yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is bananas and sweet grain.  Taste is musty, banana, spice, and a little twang in the finish.

Bottle courtesy D-Row. Pours a slightly hazy light golden color with a soft fizzy white head. Aroma is all kinds of banana and citrus notes. Also very spicy. Lovely aroma. Flavor is also lots of citrus and dry fruit peel. This has a dry spiciness as well. Well flavored but intense.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild fruity/citrusy. Mild estery, wheaty and light citrusy. Dry and estery wheaty into the finish.
Wow. Doesnt get much better then this. Taste of banana and coriander and spice. Brilliant for a warm day in the shade.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a hazy yellow straw color with a nice white head. A fair amount of lacing as it goes down. Nose is clove, banana, and some citrus. Maybe a hint of pepper. Taste is a bit sweet and fruity with a bit of spice. Nice, light and cremy feel with good carbonation levels. Overall, a very nice summer beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-20-2010

12 oz bottle

A clear favorite around the house I was only able to try one of these before the six pack had disappeared.  robust, well balanced, and ideal example of a weissbier this was just the ticket after a busy day. It reminds me that from time to time it is wise to revisit old breweries instead of chasing the latest and greatest. Otherwise you may just miss hidden gems.

Aroma / Appearance - Bubbly golden fluid poured lazily into the shaker glass. A clean white head looked as it had been run through a washing machine with ample bleach. Delicate and soft it almost seems like it will falls apart just from a wrong glance. Lemons, orange peels, citrus, and tart yeast give this a summery feel. Well balanced no one aspect dominates the overall experience.

Flavor / Palate - Lemons bubble across the palate with ease. Refreshing and dry the yeasty bite first parches before rewetting the throat. The only flaw is a little nitpick - this does get thin from time to time. However with all that it has going for it I wont criticize it too harshly. Trying to make this bigger and bolder would ruin what is a good summer lawn beer.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold, smells strongly of peach and apricot.  Taste is similar.  Fizzy and easy to drink.  Really a good example of the style, one of the best Ive had.

Poured into a weizen glass.

3.0 A: Cloudy darkish yellow color. I guess I didnt give it enough of a twirl as there is some yeast clumps at the bottom of the glass. Two fingers of frothy white head. Most of it falls quickly, but the last 1/4 inch is stalwart. Leaves behind only a touch of lacing.

5.0 S: What a lovely aroma! Pleasant throughtout with a neutral wheat backbone and spicy yeastiness. Theres plenty of banana phenols and, lemon zest, and peppery yeastiness.

3.0 T: Unfortunately, the taste doesnt measure up to the nose. In fact, its rather bland. The wheat comes through, but theres a lack of other flavors than youd come to expect. The spicy peppery yeast is gone. No hints of banana, straw, or lemon zest. Too bad.

3.5 M: Light body. Good full carbonation. No flaws, but just average.

3.0 D: I want more flavor in a hefe.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-07-2010 00:36:07

Bottle. Poured a medium DEEP yellow with a small white fizzy head that was fully diminishing and had fair lacing. the aroma was heavy of wheat and grain malts, leathery yeasty with a nice hint of citrus hops and notes of banana. It tasted quite yeasty and mildly bitter from beginning to end with the finish having a nice yeasty/citrus aftertaste. Mouthfeel was light in body and watery in texture with a strong fizzy carbonation. Overall a nice refreshing brew that is very drinkable, but very light.

Bottle. Moderate malt note of straw, light to moderate hops and yeast of lemon and barnyard with hints of bubble gum and clove. Head is average size, fizzy, white with fair lacing and is fully lasting. Color is slightly hazy, sparkling light yellow. Flavor starts faintly sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a carbonation between lively and fizzy. Lots of Hefeweizen type aromas and very tasty, but just nothing really outstanding about it.

12oz bottle from Liquor Loft.  Hazy yellow pour with a medium white head.  Lemon honey aroma.  Taste is crisp lemon, orange, clove, wheat and yeast.  Drinks smooth enough with a a creamy-ish grain finish.  Dig it within the style.  Could drink a sixer without complaint.
On tap at RattlenHum Victory event.  Nice floral aroma.  Very tasty hefeweizen - a bit of lemony tang, some sweetness and sharpness too.

On tap.
Yellow with some haze and a thin head. Strong aroma of cloves, banana, and a faint nutty component. Light bodied and very drinkable.

12 oz bottle. pored into a weizen glass. Pours hazy golden orange. Head is very fluffy, white, and stays for a bit. Little lacing..  Exceedingly worth the price of admission... Aroma is somewhat a standard Hefe, smells of banana and all-spice. Flavor is where this one shines. Great orange/banana flavors. Little bit of sourness at the beginning, with a good amount of carbonation. A GREAT job by Victory!  If I didnt see the bottle and did a blind taste test, I would say this beer was brewed by a German brewer.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazed golden yellow color with a white head.  Wheat, yeast, banana aroma.  The flavor is quite nice and refreshing.  Lively mouthfeel with prickly carbonation on the tongue.  Slight tartness in the finish.  Very drinkable.
Bottle pours a cloudy yellow gold brew with a thin white head (using a lager class sadly). Wheat and banana scent. Taste is more wheat. Not my style but one of the better ones I have had so far.

golden dark with white head.  nose of yeasty esters.  mild bitterness.  a lot of clove that overwhelms the orange.  a nice full mouthfeel that doesnt finish with too much residual sweetness.  very nice version, top of the line

Cloudy yellow color. Not that classic "glowing orange" i am used to with this style. The aroma is good enough. However, the flavor is quite lacking. The spice seems to overtake the citrus or fruit. There are some peppery bits floating around. The finish is on the bitter side. Dissapointing.

A semi opaque yellow-golden pour with a two finger white sudsy head. The aroma comes off with gratuitous wheat malt, banana, clove, and citrus with a beautiful dough characteristic. The flavor hols hints of grininess, but they are very mild. Banana and clove dominate again, with crisp lemon-orange citrus and dough creating a nice balance. the palate is thin, but full for the style, with lively pillowy effervescence with a clean, crisp texture.

16 ounce pint - $5.25 at Taco Mac in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Served to my end of the bar a clearish, light gold body with a small, white head.

Smell: A nose smelling predominately of husky, grainy wheat malt and cloves paired with lighter, though noted sniffs of lemon and Noble hops.

Taste: A start of anticipated tangy wheat malt with an integrated lemon citrus character and slight sweetness. Enter the cracked cloves which really push aside the other tastes. A light backing of Noble hops provides an additional spiciness and light bitterness. As it warms, the lemon flavor increases slightly. Finishes dry with a final mix of malted wheat and cracked cloves.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Positively acceptable! While not the most wondrous weiss it still makes for fine, tasty summertime drinking.

Serving: Draft at the Magnolias Beer Festival. 
It pours a cloudy yellow with a sizeable white head.  The nose is light with notes of lemon and a bit of wheat.  The flavor has a slight off metallic note, but that is quickly erased by lemon, wheat, and soft yeast notes.  Light in body with average carbonation and a clean finish.  Not a bad summer quaff, but not a mind blower either.

On tap at the Blind Tigers Victory event.  Pours a hazy gold with a medium sized white head.  Soft yeast and banana.  Great sweetness, soft banana.  Wheat, tangy lemon, soft sweet wheat and lemon.  Awesome stuff.

Bottle.  Pours bright golden yellow with some orange hints, topped with a thick fluffy white head.  Some large, dark sediment is suspended.  Aromas of yeast, sugar, and plum.  Flavor is caramel, apple, yeast, fruit, and spices.  Sweet, bubbly, and refreshing.  Good.

7/9/10.  On tap in a pint glass.  Huge funky and spicy aroma on this one with rotten citrus in there as well.  Big orange and orange peel flavor with that pleasant wheat creaminess.  Flavor is better than the aroma.

Bottled.  Poured hazy bright golden with a dense, tall cap of white head.  The aroma picked up sweet, toasted banana and cloves, with vanilla laced throughout and peppery highlights.  The flavor found more vanilla and less banana, with just about the same amount of spicy cloves.. prickly and a little hot on the finish.. not bad, but it lost its composure on the back-end.  Light-medium bodied and spicy on the palate.. dried out nicely in the end.. not a great hefe, but Id drink more (especially if fresh).
Nice aroma of banana and clove.  Pours a hazy light yellow, with a fluffy white head.  Nice crisp mouthfeel, with hints of lemon and spice.  Very easy drinking and quite tasty on a hot summer day.

Tap at Seans. Pours a cloudy yellow with a strong white head. Nice bready aroma with plenty of yeast and wheat. Flavor has good sweetness up front, with notes of banana and clove. Light ot medium in body with average carbonation and a smooth, almost creamy texture. Finishes with more bread notes and sweetness. Very good.
Cloudy yellowish pour.  Fluffy white head.  Nice crisp yeast, lemon and malt aroma.  Flavor is refreshing and a bit tart with good wheat, clove and banana flavor.  Good summer brew.

This was just what I needed for the humid summer. Tall glass from the tap. Murky yellow color with small head. the aroma is mostly bananna and grain. The taste was light sweetness and refreshing. Hit the spot, solid hefe.
Bottle. Light golden hazy pour with some white head.  Banana, clove, and spices aromatics. Crisp hefe flavor.

12oz bottle. Pours a very hazy golden, thick frothy head with big lacing. Was foaming harsh out of the bottle, took awhile to pour it all. Strong clove aroma, slight banana to it, sweet overall, also has a tiny bit of the "wet blanket." Very clove-y flavor, some very minor bitterness, and slight fruit. Noticeable but not strong grain flavor. High carbonation, slick texture, medium body.

holy god. Victory has sucessfully copied my favorite hefe, Paulaner. the best part of that is that its about a dollar cheaper a bottle than Paulaner! rock on! this is amazing. very well done. a perfect example of the style.
Tap at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Clear straw color, scant lacing.  Aroma of banana, lemon.  Taste is sour lemon and bubblegum.  Nice enough.
A wheat beer with a summer kick.  Spicy and fruity at the beginning with a nice smooth unfiltered end.
Hefeweizens are a sure fire way to refresh my palate. A little sweet a little dry with a fruit aroma to it. This one has a dark hazy color to it with no foam. Refreshing and very enjoyable.

Hazy golden w huge head, fades relatively quickly.... big nose, clove, wheat, yeast, some banana... medium body, lingering banana/clove, a touch watery in the right way.... flavors follow the aroma very closely, smells good, tastes like it smells...
Yeasty aroma. Some fruit and orange peel. Pours cloudy amber gold. Medium bodied. Rated 4/4/10

A- Translucent very light straw yellow body with uniform cloudiness. Pours with a huge creamy white head that slowly settles to 1 finger and has great retention. Some lacing is left behind in the glass.

S- Lots of citrus upfront with a big peppery spice essence. Big yeasty and banana smell in the background.

T- Lots of peppery spice upfront with accents of citrus and bubblegum. Firm yeasty backbone. The finish is a combination of citrus and bitter hops and comes off a little bit acidic. Sweet bready yeast along with a residual spiciness linger. I just love this spiciness in a hefe.

P- High carbonation and sweet, smooth yeasty body with just the right amount of thickness.

O- This is a great job by Victory. Great interpretation of a German Hefe. This is a great and drinkable summer beer. Its too bad I didnt pick it up until after the release of all the Oktoberfests. Will stock up on plenty of this next year.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-29-2007 16:58:38

Victory Brewing Company--Sunrise Weissbier--Unfiltered Wheat Beer--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  5.70% ABV--15 IBUs.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Wheat Ale--Beer of the Month Club Selection May, 2007.  Foamy thin white head.  Clear thin bright yellow color hazes slightly with light sediment  .Crisp Bavarian wheat spice front.   Dry sweet citrus Bavarian wheat ester body.  Mild sour citrus end.  Off.	Sampled 11/24/2007.

Strong yeast aroma with scent of banana / fruit. Cloudy golden appearance with a very light head that disappears quickly.  Not a sweet beer.  Medium body with carbonation ( a little fizzy).   A very solid hefeweizen with full flavors.
Bottle.  Pours a golden body with a white head. Wheat and banana clove notes.  Sweet with spices some wheat tones, lemon grass.  A nice hefe.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2009 12oz beer. Pours hazy golden orange. Head is very fluffy, white, and doesnt hang around long. Lacing isnt prominent either. Looks as if it may be a disappointing beer, but actually turns out to be exceedingly worth the price of admission... Aroma is somewhat dampened by the relatively age, but still smells of banana and all-spice.  Flavor is where this one shines. Great orange/banana flavors. Little bit of sourness at the beginning, with a good amount of carbonation. A good beer.

And the kicker: I bought three six-packs of this stuff at $3.99 a piece. Wells Discount Liquor, thank you very much for keeping this stuff stocked well beyond the summer.
Very good. Lightly spicy wheat flavor. Medium carbonation, well balanced flavor. Light bodied and refreshing, but not watery at all. Short, peppery finish.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2010 Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  This beer is similar to the other Bavarian hefeweizens, but with a nice crisp citrus flavor.  Highly carbonated, light body, and little lacing.  This beer is a hazy golden color and has a medium white head that disappears quickly.  The flavors are yeast, wheat, clove, and citrus (mostly lemon with just a tang of orange) with just a hint of banana.

12oz bottle.  Pours a straw yellow color with a big puffy white head.  Aroma of clove, banana,and lemon.  The tastes were of bananas, clove, spices, sweet malts, light wheat grain.  Beer is very smooth and easy to drink.

12 oz bottle.  Pours pale golden, straw in colour, with persistent frothy head.  Strong hop aroma, hints of citrus and fruit, floral esters.  Taste is slightly sweet, with citrus or fruity finish.  Light body.  Great drinkability.
Poured golden with a large white head. Aroma was of wheat, cloves, and banana. Taste was both sweet and citrusy. Finish was a little short for me. Overall a solid version

12oz Bottle  99 Bottles  Federal Way, WA
Aroma: Nice wheat and banana aroma.  Light with spice.  
Appearance: Golden in color, Hazy with a light head.  
Flavor: Big wheat malt and spices the clove came out nicely..  
Palate: Dry Finish, with a Good Mouthfeel.  
Overall: I liked this brew it was a nice Hefe.

Poured cloudy and golden with a fizzy white.  The aroma was lemony fresh.  Plenty of clove and spice along with it.  The flavor was a refreshing blend of tart lemon and spices.  Thin mouthfeel.  Lots of carbonation.  A pretty good summer-session type of beer.

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour, nice white head.  Lots of clovey lemon with a touch of fruity sweetness on the aroma.  Flavor comes through with a very light banana up front, then moves into a very lemon filled spice heaven, clove all over the place.  Not as thick as some German style hefes, but so spiced that it almost puts itself in a different category of goodness.  Excellent by no means, but a damn good spiced up here we have here!!

Bottle. Poured a cloudy golden with a creamy white head that left light lace. Aromas of clove, lemon, and light banana. The flavor had clove, lemon, and wheat. Medium body and a slightly fizzy carbonation.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a substantial white head. Cloves a hint of honey and bubblegum on the aroma. Light body active carbonation. The cloves predominate in the taste as well, with a bit of bread and banana. Crisp and spicy finish that fades into floral hops. 
 
I didnt initially know this was a German Hefeweizen, so I tried a second pour after having roused the yeast. Cloudy gold, softer flavor a bit more banana, some apple, yeast and really, a pretty damn good Hefeweizen. Im jacking my score up.
 
For anyone who wants a well rounded clove-dominated Hefe, this is your beer!

Cloudy dark gold, decent white head. Nice aroma of citrus and, uh, more citrus. Flavor is lemony at first, then a nice note of banana and bubblegum. Not particularly complicated, but tasty and refreshing.

Orange, banana, apple and clove in the nose. The oranges really pop out of this one. A slightly cloudy light yellow. Banana, yeast, grain and a bit of alcohol in the flavour. Tangy all around. This one is nummy.

Pours really light. A pale, faded honey color, with a very small head. Wheat, other grains (cereal), a slight honey sweetness and a bit of citrus in the aroma. The flavor is more floral, or herbal - and weaker. Not very good. I suppose this would be good on a hot day, but what wouldnt? Very, very "meh."

12oz bottle.  Ranked 1st out of 4 in my blind Hefe tasting [4th Arbor Bavarian Bliss, 3rd Sam Adams, 2nd Stoudts Heifer-in-Wheat] 
Pours a cloudy straw/bright gold with a medium thicker white fine froth.  Aroma is really nice, quite yeasty, juicy apples, spicy banana, clove, vanilla, full, softly rich, very fragrant, decadent 8.5.  Flavor is delicate and dry, soft green banana, white pepper, fried dough, super yeasty, juicy sweetness.     Med/light bodied with a smooth mouthful, sharper but smooth sizzling carbonation.
draft at coles- enjoyed this quite a bit- a real quencher- very similiar to sn keller, but a bit less body- banana and clove dominate, with a nice wheat bite. very good.
Cloudy yellow pour with a huge white head. Lemon, bread, banana and spice aromas. Nice and dry and an excellent summer brew.

Hazy yellow pour with a pale orange tinge.  Lots of bubbles and carbonation.  Very thick white head on top.  Sweet malt aroma with hints of honey and spice.  Bitter yeast flavor with a touch of banana.  Way over carbonated, but refreshing and light.
bottle via SS, nice cloudy yellow with foamy head, aroma of citrus and light spice, flavor is mellow wheat , lemons, spice, good finish
Sampled at the 8th Annual Music City Brewers Festival.  Hazy orange-yellow, white head.  Aroma is cloves and oranges.  Taste is more clove spice, oranges, wheat.
Pours murky yellow with a foamy head that lasts a few minutes. Aroma is yeast, wheat, and some tangy citrus. Taste is wheat and spice, not overpowering. Medium thin body with heavy carbonation.

The color is a clear golden yellow with a thin head that fades very quick. The nose has some floral notes blended with malted wheat and other grains and hints of lemon grass. As you sip on it you can taste a bit of a yeast funk with subtle hops and malted wheat. It is nice and crisp and refreshing but could use more bite. Overal it has a nice complexity and flavor.

Source:12 oz bottle from Tower Package in Atlanta. 
Glass:Weizen. 
Appearance:Cloudy yellow pour with a two finger white head.  
Aroma:Spices and wheat with a hint of banana and citrus. 
Flavor:Wheat and cloves with a mild banana finish. 
Palate:Light body with solid carbonation.
Overall:Excellent Hefe.  A goto in the summer.

Pours a cloudy orange amber with a two finger foamy offwhite head. The nose is yeasty, clovey, some banana, wheaty, mildly sweet. The flavor is wheaty with some banana, not as much spice in the flavor, yeasty, some bubblegum. The palate is smooth and full with a low carbonation.
bottle. nice light golden hue with a good amount of head... wheat and citrus aroma... taste is of wheat, banana, cloves and citrus, well balanced for a hef... very tasty

330 mL into tumbler (no weizen over here :(  ). Pours a very cloudy dirty blonde with a two finger off-white head (would be three or four if poured into a weizen). Aroma is wheat, orange peel, pears, lemon, yeast, apricots. Taste is dried apricots and pears with some cardboardy wheat. Not too much spice balancing. Dry, cardboard aftertaste. Lacking some essentials for a hefeweizen. A good, refreshing, summer beer but not an outstanding example for the style.

Aroma soapy, sweet, and yeasty. Appearance dark and cloudy blonde. Flavor like an American version of a Belgian or German Hefeweizen. Quality. Not quite a complex enough palate for my taste, and too wannabeeish, but still a solid effort.
Pours a cloudy orange with thick white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, wheat. Similar taste. Very crisp and light. Pretty good Hefeweizen.

Mild haze considering the style.  Foamy, but quickly dissipating near white head.  Leaves no lace.  Straw color.

Strong wheat aroma with a notable dollop of yeast in the nose.

A dry beer with a sour aftertaste.  Good wheat presence in the taste.  Thin bodied--not filling at all; high level of carbonation.  A good summer beer.

Hazy gold/orangeish color with a highly carbonated white head.  Aroma of banana, citrus, and spices.  Flavor has banana and light orange with a light spiciness in the finish.  This is an excellent american-brewed rendition of the German Weissbeir variety - one of the best I have come across.

12 oz b9ottle. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a bright white head that is foamy. Nose is light pepper and some crisp citrus notes, mostly lemon. Palate is a little thin and quite effervescent. Flavors are more of the lemon and light pepper and other citrus notes.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2010 Poured from bottle. Light, crisp, and refreshing. Citrus notes. A bit of pineapple in the background. Good for a hot summers day. Would seriously consider making this my session wheat ale for the summer months.

Pours an effervescent hazy yellow colour with a foamy white head that retains very well. The aroma is intense for the style, with banana/clove wheat, coriander, kiwi, pear and other light fruits, along with some subdued impressions of citrus. The flavour is vibrant and refreshing, with lemon grass, clove, doughy bread, coriander, and light fruits. The palate is actually crisp and smooth, unlike many advertised macro lagers. It has an airy texture. Very nice representation of the style.
Pours cloudy gold with fizzy head. Aroma of banana and yeast with pear and apple maybe. Velvety on the palate. Taste is crisp with fruit and spice. An excellent example of the style.

Tasting at a beerfest [Disclaimer: This was tasted along with many, many other beers during a tasting at Julios. Some of the details are a little hazy]. Fairly typical example of this style. Good for what it is.

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour with a medium white head.  Aroma of lemongrass, coriander, cloves and wheat.  Great taste of wheat with several spices present.  Nice brew, though fairly high in ABV for a summer brew.
Poured a cloudy yellow color with a nose of somewhat peppery or tangy spices and and citrusy fruits. Smooth taste but somewhat muted flavor.

From bottles directly from the brewery.  Pours with about 1.5in of head. Pour is surprisingly clear until you dump some of the sediment in, then it gets cloudy.   Smell is very mild cloves and yeast.  Taste is yeast, cloves and banana but all are very mild, as to be expected from this style.  I enjoyed this beer a lot.  It is extremely drinkable but has ample flavor.  I also like its relatively high abv that is not in the least discernible.  Drinker be ware, if you down a few of these on a hot summer day, youll feel it without even knowing it.

Bottle.  Pours gold with a medium head.  Aroma is mildly wheaty, with a hint of clove and fruit.  Flavor has wheat, yellow fruit, and some finishing grassiness. Mouthfeel is light and crisp, finish adds dryness. OK, but a bit watery.

A clear golden pour with tight white head and lace. Aroma is clove, banana, and a light hint of bread. A sweet start that hints of brown sugar but really takes off with the clove and fruit. It dries out close to the end. Pretty aggressive carbonation but medium bodied and smooth. Really crisp and clean. I expected a more cloudy beer than this one.

This beer pours a hazy yellow with a frothy white head. 
The flavor has banana, cloves, and some tanginess with a citric finish. Its a nice hefe.

Draught @ The Distillery, Savannah. Served in pint glass. Hazy golden, small white head. Hefe yeast with ripe banana esters. Yeasty goodness. Relativey high carbonation. Thins out slightly in the finish but has no stickiness. Slight huskiness rounds out the sweet yeast character. Nice coriander spiciness and herbal with light citrus notes too. CLean finish.

Super hazy golden blonde coloured body with a nice white head. Aroma of lemons, curacao, wheat, yeast, canned corn and a bit of nutmeg. Medium-bodied; Strong pungent taste of canned corn with a little yeast and wheat flavours roaming. A bit of lemony citrus taste rounds out the beer - but not overly pleasing at all. Overall, this beer was an alright wheat - not really worth seeking out, but decent to try. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Norms in Vienna, Virginia on 04-September-2005 on the Eastern Shore of Virginia.

nice cloudy golden color with a white head and decent retention.  aroma is spicy with a hint of citurs and bubblegum.  nice flavors with hints of pepper, bubblegum, and orange and a nice thick mouthfeel.

Courtesy of sebletitje. Pours mildly hazy gold with nearly no head. The aroma pops with some wheat and light skin fruity notes. I also get a mild bouquet of yeasty spice. The taste is much the same with a refreshing burst of mild tartness enhanced by carbonation. It gets fruity, wheat and a tad spicy midway and into the finish.

pours cloudy golden with white head.
Aroma of grains, citrusy fruits and yeasty.
Mouthfeel is similar with pronounced spices and citrus - orange, notes of wheat.
Thick mouthfeel, light and easy to drink.

Thanks for the share sebletitje. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a nose of sugary banana and lemon with hints of yeast. Flavor is straw, banana, grass, citrus, and clove with some bread. Nice citrusy, bready finish. I like it.

Bottle courtesy of sebletitje. Pours a hazy pale golden with a one finger white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of spicy yeast, citrus, wheat, clove, and banana. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a mild amount of bitterness and slightly tart finish. Good.

Bottle to glass.  Im not a huge wheat beer fan but if I imainge myself if Belgium it tastes better.

Not much head.  Fruity, citrus smell.  Good overall taste

Bottle. Pours a totally clear golden color with a tiny white head. The aroma is sweet cloves, other spices, and some apples. A nice initial spicy mix, mostly cloves, some banana, some apples and cinnamon, lemon and light crisp flavors. A very nice hefe.

Cloudy honey gold hue, with a white head, leaving some laces, nice yeasty, spicy bananaish nose, with some clove, cinnamon accents, with a honeyed wheat malt note, with some pineapple, pear, peach fruitiness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, zesty, fruity banana, wheaty character, with some cinnamon, clove spiced notes, some candied honeyed pineapple, pear, peach accents, leading towards a smooth fruity, wheaty, milkyish finish.

On tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Pours a kristalweizen light pale yellow. Aroma is light banana & clove. Some lemony citus wheat  also. Taste is citrus wheat with mile hefe characteristics. Makes a nice summer beer. Presently 40 & cold in Buffalo

On top at Victoy and by the bottle. This is definitely a decent Hefe but I wish it had a little more flavour. It had a little of the fruit and spice smell but not as much as others I have had. So it was good and I would definitely add this to my beer rounds but I have my favs I would prefer if given the choice.

Bottled. Pours a hazy pale yellow amber with a strong frothy head that doesn’t last long and has moderate lacing. Strong banana, clove, and wheat aroma. Clearly an unfiltered beer. Smooth and crisp, just the right amount of carbonation.  Flavor is classic of a hefeweizen; wheat and citrus with slight banana, clove, and spicy wheat. Comfortable refreshing palate and a very smooth finish.

12 oz. bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours a hazy orange color with a big frothy head, but low retention and lacing. Aroma is big wheat with notes of citrus and light clove. Taste is strong wheat, spice, yeast, citrus and bubblegum. Medium body. Assertive carbonation.
Poured a very large head.  Aroma of fruits and spices.  The citrus flavor is also very crip. The beer has a nice and smooth texture. This is a very solid  hefeweizen.  I enjoyed it alot.
I am shocked by how much I enjoyed this white beer. The extra carbonation adds so much.

Classic German hefeweizen.  Comes out hazy and unfiltered, straw colored with a fluffy white head.  Heavy banana and clove nose with  a very heavy clove palate.  Palate has substance but the beer refreshes.  I always enjoy Victory offerings.

This is a SOLID beer for a summer brew. It had almost the same aroma as their much stronger golden monkey. Very spicy and peppery smell but it didn’t translate to the flavor. It was very crisp and clean like alot of other beers but it had the body that most other companies cannot seem to match.

Had this from both a 12oz bottle and draft-this review is from the bottle.Poured a cloudy yellow with a quickly dissappearing white head.Aromas were nice-spice,banana,yeast and citrus.The flavor was also nice with more citrus,or lemon,light clove and banana.I really think Victory did a good job on this Hefeweizen style brew.

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of spices, coriander, banana, clove, and a little yeast and wheat.  Poured golden/yellow/corn/flax in color with a small white head that disappeared quickly.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Opaque.  No lacing.  Flavor is light to medium bitter.  Tastes of spices, clove, coriander, and hints of lemon and yeast.  Light to medium body.  Tingly, chalky texture.  Lively carbonation.  Dry clove finish.  Too bubbly.

pours cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white foam head. lots of spice and citrus on the nose. also graham cracker and pineapple. flavor is pretty standard for a hefe. this has a little more varied citrus flavor. smooth mouthfeel. very light. wheaty spicy aftertaste.

A translucent golden weizen with a thin white head. A pleasant fruity aroma of bananas, blood oranges and cloves, quite nice. In mouth, a light creamy weizen, with bananas, cloves, and notes of strawberries.  Light to medium bodied. A good quaffer.
hazy yellow hue with white foamy head, crisp and refreshing, on of the better american weizen beers, citrys at first, clove aftertaste.
Not a bad hefe, but still not what I really look for. It has all the right flavors and crispness, but it just lacks a wow factor.

On draught at Deep Ellum (Boston, MA). Pours a hazy golden with massive white foamy head that settles slowly and heavily laces the glass. Aroma is citrusy (lemon) with notes of spice, banana, yeast, some citrus rind. Flavor is spicy with citrus notes and hints of bread, yeast, clove, honey. Generally light-bodied with a refreshing crisp finish.
(Bottle).   I don’t usually enjoy wheat beers.  But this one hits the spot.  Well balanced, tangy, but not too sour.  Lots of lemony citrus notes.
Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a white head. Very fresh banana aroma with clove, nutmeg and brown sugar. Crisp in the mouth. Flavor has banana, lemon, clove, and other spices. Very solid.

12oz bottle. The pour is a cloudy golden with a quickly diminishing head of thin white head of white cream. The aroma is mildly citrusy and creamy wheat. Pretty nice.  The flavor matches the aromas pretty well. Plenty of smooth wheat character with a nice citrus character with a touch of bubblegum and lemon. Pretty nice stuff.
From the bottle poured a hazy golden color with a good amount of head.  Nice flavor, refreshing citrusi with a quick finish.
Pours hazy gold into a Weizen glass.  Fluffy large head recedes quickly to coat surface. Banana aromas. Upfront bubblegum and banana with a lasting lemon yeast finish.
Cloudy and golden, white head, nose has a presence of coriander and malt.  The flavor is clean with some citrus and spice.  Good take on the style, but not at all perfect.
Bottle, hazy orange in color. Good head... Flavor is orange, fruity, spicy and overall a good summer brew. I would buy it again.
Not much to the aroma... slight hint of citrus. Appearance is classic of a hef- light amber, cloudy. Flavor has hints of lemongrass, barley, and wheat. Overall.... "okay;"
Solid hefe.  Rather tart citrus flavors to it.  Definitely leans more towards lemon then banana and clove.  Quite refreshing on a hot day.

Murky yellow coloration. Thin to medium bodied and smooth with good carbonation.   Subtle citrusy and wheaty flavors with an ever so slight bit of sweetness.   Ends after a crisp finish with a nice spice flavor.

Foamy white head with a really cloudy yellow body. Mild banana and spice aroma. Taste of bananas and cloves and other spices. Not too light with enough body to make it not watery. A touch of maltiness is present in the beer as well.
Transfering tasting notes. Bottle. Hazy yello pour with a big white head. Lotds of clove and bread on the nose. Break an d clove on the tounge as well. Nice and light. Very good.

Draft @ Birreria Paradiso.  Pours a hazy, pale straw color; somewhat white; creamy, bright white head with excellent retention and fine-bubbled lacing.  Soft bananas, cloves, breadiness and a touch of citrus in the aroma.  Lively carbonation in the mouth, matching well to the soft, bready core; medium mouthfeel; good levels of bananas and soft cloves / spice; very drinkable and tasty overall; nothing too sweet or sticky.  Medium finish: toasty grains, bread, and bananas; ends dry with a touch of spice.
12oz bottle.  Pours cloudy yellow.  aroma is a big dough.  flavor has a thirstquenching goodness to it.  Finishes with a simple citrus flavor.  Nice wheat flavors.  very good.
Very light orange/yellow color.  Fruity, light palate.  Not an overly dry mouthfeel, which is nice.  Very sweet, wheaty, and refreshing.  Good for a hot day.

12oz. bottle. Pours a very light and soft yellow/gold that is mostly clear until you swirl in (or pour in from the bottom of the bottle) some of the yeast sediment. The head pours up immense and white and lasts impressively. The aroma is a wonderful breadiness - sweet and wheaty with delectable notes of malt sweetness and faint touch of fruit (banana). The flavor starts sweet and malty and wheaty - delicious. Some spice and fruit (clove phenols, banana esters) come in faintly at mid-palate - but not overwhelming. They are a wonderful complement to the wheaty and malty character of the beer. The finish is crisp and incredibly refreshing with a touch of noble hop bitterness and a slight tang from the blend of hops, phenols, and sweet malts. The mouthfeel is medium-full in body and invigoratingly carbonated. Overall, this is one of the best Bavarian Weissbiers Ive ever tasted - hands down.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2008 The aroma is wheaty, with bubble gum, banana, cloves, and incense. The appearance is hazy white-gold with a small head. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is watery. Overall its good.

Pours a cloudy light straw color with big white head that dissipates quickly to a just a ring around the glass.  Nose of clean citrus notes and some banana.  Some clove becomes present in the flavor with very slight medicinal qualities.  I love victory beers, but this just isnt one of my favorites.

(bottle) Pours a light hazy orange with a large white head that settles to a fine flim over the beer.  Pretty nice, but subtle aroma of light banana, orange, yeast, clove, and some lemon.  Taste is slightly sweet initially with banana again, along with some clove, lemon, with a nice twang of wheat and a yeast finish.  Mouthfeel is medium with spritzy carbonation.  Not a bad hefe, but a little too subtle on both aroma and flavor.

Bottle from Cellars Larpenteur. Nice weissbier aroma with banana and a hint of feet smell, but in a good way. Hazy light gold that is almost pale enough that it could resemble a "white". As such, doesnt look as much like a German weissbier as it tastes. Larger frothy, white sand colored head. Some artistic lace. Very good weissbier character that could easily pass for a German weissbier in a blind taste test. At mid glass it thins a bit. I have had better weissbiers but not too many that are made in America.

12oz.  Truly a winner from Victory!  Ive found that many domestic breweries have a hard time with the German Hefe style, often producing a beer more belgian in nature, but this seems to have hit the style on the head.  Pours beautifully with a cloudy yellow body and huge white head.  Lots of banana, orange and lemon in the nose and body, with the slightest bitter notion of lime.  My only complaint is that the body is the slightest bit thin but the carbonation is very refreshing.

bottle.  pours clear golden yellow with a nice frothy white head.  we got this one one sale.  it has been sitting around since last season, so it was pretty skunked.  otherwise, a really nice wheat.  the yeast is fruity, tart, and musty.  nice crisp palate - high carbonation.  not as cloudy as hefes come but in all a great summer beer.

Pours a pretty classic cloudy amber with a thin but quickly dissipating soapy white head. The aroma is of orange, cloves,  bubble-gum and a bit of generic spice. The flavor is more classic hefe - lots of citrus right up front and carrying through into a fine bitter finish, some banana and spice in support, but the citrus dominates the flavor for the most part. The mouth-feel is very crisp, very refreshing but perhaps a little over-carbonated. I am a big fan of the style, and I just admit, this is the first American hefe that Ive truly enjoyed...I can only imagine that it would be even better in the heat of summer.
Pours a cloudy yellow color. Aroma of wheat, spices and banana. Tastes of wheat and alot of banana. decent beer, excellent for the style.

First impressions of this beer were very very poor, but I tried it again a few months later with a light chicken salad dinner and found it very pleasant.  Pours light and cloudy (as it is unfiltered) this beer is refreshing though admittedly a bit over carbonated.  Citrus flavors are very evident, particulary in the after taste.  All-in-all, it was a decent beer.  Im interesting in seeing how I like it in another couple months.

Draft at McGraths Pub in Harrisburg, PA. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Typical banana clove aroma. Refreshing body, but a tad watery in the middle. Flavor of pale wheat malt, lemon, banana, and clove. I detect a tad more bitterness that I do with other Hefes. Finish is yeasty, but had some distracting phenol that I did not care for. Not bad, but I prefer a little more sweetness and body.

June 2006 - Beer pours with nice head and lacing. Wonderful banana and clove and wheaty aroma. As the first sip passed my lips, I thought "WONDERFUL!" I very rich wheaty base (which I like) and a nice amount of the standard banana and clove flavors in the background. However, at the end of the sip, a lemon citrusy zing emerged which I found unpleasant. Also, the carbonation level was a bit high for my liking, which kept this from being as smooth as I would like. Good, but not great. My quest for the great American Hefeweizen in a bottle continues.
Pours a light golden color with a large white head. Aroma of banana, spices, and bubblegum. Nice flavor, easy drinking. Very good.

Bottle.  Sweet and surprisingly spicy aroma, wheat and lemon with grass and the prickle of coriander without the flavor accent.  Pale yellow-golden pour and very excitable (very noisy, too), soapy white head with a good deal of carbonation.  Chalky wheat taste with strong banana and light bubblegum, strong wheat and medium yeast, lighter pretzel and bread.  Lightly floral but not perfumed.  Invigorating!  Light-medium body but still crisp and very refreshing, alcohol is undetectable and this sucker makes a great chugger.  Light, cheerful, well-made wheat.  What can I say?  It hit at the right time.
12oz bottle. Nice hazy pour with large head.  The body appears very carbonated. The usual coriander, lemon, wheat, and bananas are present... it finishes with strong notes of clove and spice.

Bottle via trade with piscator34. Hazy light gold with a big shaving cream head and a very active body. Aroma is mostly right on style - yeast, lemon, wheat, banana - with a hint of grassy hops to kick things up a bit. Mouthfeel is crisp and spritzy at first, softening up after a bit of time in the glass. Very nice flavour with all the expected notes - wheat, yeast, lemon, banana, clove, and a bit of bubblegum. A nice refresher.

12oz bottle courtesy of Degarth. Pours a hazy golden color with tons of carbonation bubbles, and a huge, pillowy white head. About 2.5 fingers thick, and pretty nice retention for the style. Also nice lacing as well. Nose of lemons, oranges, wheat, grass and light banana. Get some spice in there as well, maybe some clove and a little extra, but cant really pin it down. Flavor adds a lot more spice, heavy on the clove, and then a sweet backing from the fruit and yeast. Heavily astringent. Light to medium bodied, spritzy mouthfeel.  Finish is banana, clove, oranges and wheat, medium length and refreshing.

Slightly cloudy golden color with a large white head that disappeared quickly.  Spiced citrus aroma with notes of banana.  Tangy citrus and spiced fruit flavor.  Refreshing spice lingers on after the finish.
Bottled samle courtesy of Piscator.  Nice citrus and banana aroma.  G=Lots of bubbles which I like.  Did not pair it with the right food, but was starter anyway.

Pour is a hazy light gold with some legs.  Rather large marshmellow like head.  Citrusy lemon and banana aroma.  Slightly sour flavor, which differenciates it from other hefes.  I kind of like that about it, making it unique in that manner.  Good refreshing beer from Victory.  Id buy it again.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2008 12 oz Bottle-Pours a clear light golden color w/almost no head. Slight spiced aroma. Had a lot of carbonation, flavors of citrus, spice, bananas, & bread dough. Had a sharp bite to it, no sweetness at all. A little rough around the edges. This one was ok, but I prefer my Hefes to be a little more of an easy drinking, session type beer, something you can sit down & knock back a few, this beer doesnt fit that bill. Not one of Victorys best efforts.

Sampled this again & found it to be much more enjoyable, guess my taste are expanding. Had a nice spicy bite to it that I found rether refreshing after a day @ the beach. Good summer brew.
This was eh.  Victorys worst offering and rendition of a style in my opinion.  Not as good as other wheat beers/hefes.
Had this on vacation in bottle.  Had an aroma that mislead to the true taste.  Very much unfiltered with a grainy taste.  Satisfying though and is very refreshing.

Courtesy of Piscator34.
This is my first beer of the day after a night of drinking an entire bottle of DFH Fort (a masochistic endeavour if there ever was one). Great looking pour on this sucker. Big billowing white head. Straw coloured ale, and is more clear than expected. If I hadnt really shaken the yeast loose from the bottom of bottle, it would have been totally clear. Not a commanding nose on this- some clove and citrus. Taste- quite clean. Spritzy carbonation and mild hefe character to it. Light bodied with lime and lemon citrus. More american wheat than hefe, but tasty none the less. This is a nice simple summer time beer. I would buy this by the caseload in the summer if I could.
12oz bottle. Pours cloudy golden color with full foamy white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma banana and spices. Taste lite sweet, lemons and wheat with clean finish.

Hazy light gold in colour with strong carbonation. Loads of vanilla and clove aromas (somewhat sugar cookie-like), with the more fruity banana and citrus notes bringing up the rear. In the mouth the vanilla and clove lead the way again, but the fruit centred follow-up is a bit more complex, with some darker spice notes coming into play. It seems to be quite bitter for the style, although not excessively so. Medium bodied, and just a hair too thin on the finish. Very enjoyable and drinkable, and could be a really world class if they could sort out the palate issues.

12 Oz Bottle. Stagnant aroma of lingering hexanes and hop grains. Bits of banana sauce and white sugar. Pours an unsettlingly clear pale straw champagne, floating a head of clean white. Flavor is a reduced yeast product showing, with esters, classic hefe notes, and a smattering of random hop and malt notes, pale and relatively clean. A bit skunky, tints of DMS and mouthwash. Lightly chewy resin hops back out the driveway. Body ebbs thin, but the curt chemical profile defies the naming of heavily drinkable. Mediocre at best.

Ive had three of these and each time they have been too cold.  But basically, this could be confused with a German bier if it was warmer.  Once it does warm up, the aroma and taste are very close to the weissbier of the Fatherland.

A decent lemon yellow appearance. A very nice citrus and malt smell. Wow, the fruits just open up when I smell the beer. The beer is even somewhat cold, and I can smell the fruit. The yeast smell is very distinct. Out of all the beers I have tried, I am continually impressed with the smell of a good hefeweizen. The flavors of the malt and the yeast just never cease to impress me.  A nice yeast and malt taste that just knocks my tastebuds out with the citrus taste. The yeast is very distinct in this beer. The beer is a little TOO carbonated for me, but still a well rounded hefeweizen. The citrus flavor is also very crip. The beer has a nice and smooth texture. I am enjoying this beer, and I would definitely drink it again. One of the best hefeweizens I have ever tried.

acquired from trade with ucusty...muddy yellow pour. aromas of wheat, lemon/tart, yeast and a woody seediness. flavor is much the same with some grassy hops and spicy bitterness. light bodied and very refreshing.
Pours hazy yellow with a large head.  The notes of orange peel and cloves push into the palate and thriugh the finish.  I nice bitterness ensues and shows good balance.

Bottle best before June 14, 08 split with Tronraner in a blind hefeweizen tasting. This was the lightest of the four pours with a shimmering, cloudy golden color and excellent head retention. The frothy white head lasted during the entire session. This had deeper spiced notes, second most robust in our little taste, with added emphasis on the citrusy, floral notes. Great balance here of cloves, banana, wheat crackers. Lots of subtle nuances in the flavor as well. This leans more towards a grassy, slightly green take on the style. Its a nice beer with a well rounded flavor profile. The finish is reasonably tart with a lemon seed aspect. I enjoyed the transition over my palate from juicier flavors to the drying finish. Id say this was the hoppiest hefe of the night with discernable citrus character.

12 oz. bottle, in a blind tasting of German-style hefeweizen with NachlamSie. Pours cloudy gold with excellent tight white head that lasts forever and bubbles that constantly climb the side of the glass. The aroma is banana peel, orange zest, dry floral hoppiness. The flavor is prickly and zesty. Good floral hops come out quickly, slightly hoppy for the style, but that is a pleasant surprise for me. It fades to a grainy and honey finish. Some mild spiciness lingers there, too. As it warms a little, earthy notes come out both in the nose and the mouth. Pretty good beer.

Date: 07/17/2006
Mode: Bottle
Source: Roadtrip

hazy golden yellow, whispy white head, creamy body, sweet aroma blend of banana and clove, nice banana flavor, only a hint of the clove, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3.1/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *4

A nice surprise in this one.  Got home from a wedding reception and wanted another beer.  A friend of mine had brought this one back from Philly for me.  Reminded me more of a witbier than a weissbier.  Nice citrus notes but also had some floral notes as the beer warmed a bit - some rose-like aromas.  Very pleasant.  Poured with a nice wihte head with nice even lacing and high carbonation.  Yellow color on this nice sweet summer beer.  I really enjoyed it.  Another good offering from the brewers at Victory.
Bottle: Pour is a cloudy, golden color, with a thin bubbly head, aroma is citrus, spice and yeast, flavor is citrus and dry with a light mouthfeel.  Nice brew.
clear yellowish-light golden color, head is white and frothy. aroma is lemony tart and yeasty. flavor is bubblegum and a spot of clove. excellent hefeweizen.

Cloudy Yellow Color with White Soapy Head. Citrus, Coriander and Yeasty Aroma. Light to Medium Mouthfeel.  A Bit Sudsy and Dry...Suspect it to be a Bad Bottle.  Still Some Nice Citrus and Light Spice Notes...Overall Dry Spice and Yeast Flavor Througout. Not a Hefe to be Drank Session Style, but a Nice Step up From There.
Strong flavor, good carbonation, classic german lemon gold color, light banana aroma, and refreshing aftertaste. A very good weissbier.

Orange straw with a fluffy white head.  Fresh orange, spice and hops on the nose.  Crisp and round on hte palate.  Orange and coriander with a touch of hops on the finish.  One of the best hefes Ive ever had.

The aroma is very bubblegum like with a hint of cheese life flavor. The palate is a tad thin and the carbonation seem flat. malts are very weak. it does some fruit flavors with minor cloves. not superb.

Pours a cloudy, golden straw color with a white, full, creamy-fluffy head with fair longevity and decent lacing.  Nose is nice with loads of bana and bubblegum, light yeast, faint lemon citric sourness, and light spice notes of clove.  Flavor is more balanced; bubblegum, banana, light yeast, lemons, clove, and unripe pear (like I saw in ones description).  Palate is light to medium, nearly lively, and refreshing. Finishes short and ghostly with banana and yeast.  Fairly decent hefe with nice prominant hefe notes, just nothing make it a great hefe.

Haze whitened-yellow. Fluffy and pasty white head shows impressive retention. Uplifting aroma of lemon, pear, straw, and airy phenolics. Fluffy effervescence. Airy and light on its feet with a dense Juicy Fruit core kissed with sweet pear (grit and all) and spicy clove. Pure note of bubblegum emerges fairly late, but hangs around long enough to help pillar the body. Quite juicy and quenching with a pleasant unripe pear acidity and a hint of green banana as well. Malt, however, is grainy and thus fails to impart any significant depth or anything for the subtler flavors to latch onto. Harsh minerals lend a firm bitterness late which compounds the graininess. Wheat-derived starches develop as it warms, and contribute a nutty sweetness. Finishes soft and slickly fruity with green raisin and delicate banana notions, but rather short in length with lingering chalky yeast. A bit muted and slightly grainy, but certainly not as heavily flawed as many other Victory beers tend to be.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle Golden pour with huge white head. Aroma of yeast, banana and wheat. Flavor follows with a bit more citrus. Smooth. Good hefe.

hazy gold with nice lacing and a large foamy white head.  banana and clove aroma.  sharp carbonation.  light bodied.  flavor has the usual notes of banana and clove but also a very bitter finish.   sparkly carbonation like tonic water with a citrus twist.

Great summer offering from Victory. Nice fruity, and lightly spiced aroma. Flavors of light banana and just a hint of citrus, with a balancing wheat undertone throughout, and a bit of spice towards the finish.

Banana to bubblegum aroma, with lesser hay, beef, and lemon notes. Only slightly cloudy golden color. Very thick sudsy head. Flavor is rather disappointing. Weak clove and banana. A bit like rusty pipes on the palate. Wonderfully complete and complex aroma is misleading.

Bottle poured a cloudy yellow with a large lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast and lemon. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of bread dough, yeast and a hint of citrus with a crisp clean finish. Smells better than it tastes!

Pours a cloudy unfiltered yellow with a creamy white head. Smells of rich malts, pit fruit, musty basement, wheat and coriander. Taste is also fresh with citrus, vegetable hops, wheat, overall rather dry. Good beer though, especially for the summer.

A lovely pour of light golden color and cloudy consistency.  Aroma of garlic and sun-dried tomatoes.  The rest of the oil and vinegar soaked olive bar is vaguely present.  A bit musty.  Crisp on the tongue.  Flouride and green apples lend a very quiet sweetness.  Primarily doughy with banana, dill, and cloves.  Dry finish is slightly papery after a tart bite.  No flaws, and right on pitch.

No head, pale yellow with light cloudiness and medium to high carbonation. Light wheat aroma, sweet. taste is a dry citrus, grainy, with hints of german hops. Just a little too sweet. Too carbonated. Finishes bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2011 ive actually been anticipating this beer for some time.  its actually proven to be somewhat elusive in the land of many Victories.  pours more yellow than most german hefeweizens.  aroma is very lemony. same with the flavor.  not much of the characteristic banana and bubblegum.  a little bit of a tartness.  overall, disappointing.

This is one of the lowest beers Ive rated. I love German wheat beer, there is a great bar in New York where I get the goods. The pour on this was foamy beyond any reason, and the aroma and taste just not to my liking. Everybody else reviewed it really nicely, maybe Im doing something wrong.

Bottled. Beer is cloudy light gold with a small, white, frothy, mostly and quickly diminishing head.

First aromatic impression is invitingly dry, herbal, standing on lean malt notes of light-to-moderately toasted bread/cracker; Hoppy with moderate notes of herbal resin/pine, honeysuckle florals, light note of lemon zest; Yeasty with a trace of dusty attic; Trace of coriander.

Flavor is big. Moderately acidic, moderately sweet, lightly bitter with a long, lightly acidic, light/moderately sweet, lightly bitter finish. Lasting dryness in the finish.

Luxe palate. The body is medium, the texture is velvety/watery and the carbonation is lively.

Nice rendition.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color, with a nice rocky white head.  Very earthy, spicy (clove especially), and a hint of banana.  Light citrusy carbonated mouthfeel with plenty of spice.  The mid-palate is assaulted by very dry floral hops that carry this finish a long way.  Very nice American hefe.
user_location: Farewell Minny; Hello Puyallup, Washington, USA

text: Yes, finally an American Hefe that actually resembles the beer style. Thanks Victory for ending my search. Aroma is yeasty with good notes of banana, clove, and vanilla. Pale gold pour with heavy carbonation. Immediate cloudy white head, but it quickly fades. Decent lacing, good haze from the swirled yeast. Medium body, filling yet crisp enough to be quenching. Drinkable and not too heavy. Great wheat and yeast content. Typical fruity banana with a noticeable clove flavor. Slight peppery bite rounded out by vanilla and almond flavors. Overall Im giving this a high score for being a great American representation of this style.

Slightly hazed and nearly white, a pearish appearance, going on green, nearly, with a puffy, active crown of foam above.

Sweet, then tart nose, loaded with citrus and spice...tons of orange and lemon, with that banana & clove kick in their, too....nice.

Very refreshing, a blast of flavor, bitter, tart, then sweet and smooth. Plenty more hops in this than your average German Weissbier. Tart from the citrus flavors in the hops, bitter a bit, then just refreshing and delicious. 

Long, tart, citric, hoppy finish, medium bodied...
bottle.  I really liked this weiss.  A great crispness to it.  Sort of tangy.  A very good mix of spice, wheat, bitter and tang.  I was a little surprised.
bottle.  hazy golden. white head.  wheat, banana, beautiful yeast, mild spice aroma.  great vbody.  lively and bitter.  rounding yeast and wheat.  spicy.  great.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a big fluffy white head and some lacing. The aroma has some tartness with nice some nice spicy undertones. The flavor has a nice tart citrus zing to it with a bread-like wheat flavor with some citrus and spicy notes. Well-made beer.
Bottle.  Cloudy yellow body with a white head.  Aroma is spicy with some banana.  Flavor is spicy (cloves mostly) with a nice touch of banana and wheat.

Bottle. Spicy yeast on the nose. Just a hint of banana, dried hay, fresh cut grass and clove. Pours bright cloudy gold with a billowy white head. Dry spicy yeast on the palate. Sourdough crust. Very dry, spicy flavor. Mouth filling carbonation. Finishes spicy and dry.

Cloudy yellow body with plenty of white head.  Nice wheat nose spicy clove undertones.  The banana is there in the nose but very faint.  Wheaty body with a crisp finish.  Spice dominates the banana.  One of the best Ive had from this style.

Bottle from 2005. This bottle held up very well.  Pours a cloudy gold with 4 finger airy head slowly giving way to a pleasent film.  Lots of carbination, and the aroma of bananas. finshs with a spicy/tangy flavor. very nice american weiss

A nice yellow, slightly cloudy colored body.  It had a thick frothy white that had some lacing.  A nice aroma, with a mix of citrus notes, yeast notes, and peppery notes.  Flavor was similar but the yeast notes were more complex, sweet initially and somewhat bread-like towards the end, but the flavor was dominated buy a nice pepper bite. I had this beer on probably the hottest day so far, and it truly is a summer beer.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a small, half inch tight head and better than average lacing.  The smell was wheat, lemon, and bubblegum.  Smooth, refreshing taste with a good mouthfeel.  This is a nice summer beer.

Hazy, yet bright yellow pour with a meringue like white head. Clove and bubblegum aroma with a hint of lemon. Banana and estery flavor - nice and subtle and smooth. Mouthfeel is pleasant and refreshing. Has all the requisites of an excellent Hefe - not much more to say. Very refreshing in the summer heat. Thanks to Aurelius for saving this out of his Ale in the Mail shipment.

One of the best hefes Ive had. Strong aroma of wheat and yeast. Pour was a light gold at the bottom and it gradually got darker as it went up the glass. Nice 2 finger white head with good lacing. Taste of bread, yeast and banana. Nice and crisp and all the flavors fill the mouth and dont go short.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours with a azy straw yellow color and a smallish head. Strong aromas of wheat, bubblegum, bread and yeast. Very nice flavors of wheat, yeast, dough. One of the best Amercian interpretations of this style, true to the German intent. Loved this beer, goes well with spicy foods or just as a thirst quencher in summer.
Prettty good beer for a Micro Weiss beer.  Usually micro weiss taste flat.  this has a nice citrus taste.  cloudy texture

Pours pale yellow with bone white-foamy head and minimal carbonation.  It reminds me of meringue pie.  The aroma is sweet and citrusy and further reminds me of meringue pie.  The taste has a sweet and sour thing going with lots of spunk from the carbonation that is released as it enters your mouth.  Lemon flavor comes through.   Has a tangy, spunky feel from the carbonation.

12 oz bottle via MALT OF tHE eARTH bEER cLUB. Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Nose is bananna, clove, honey. Taste starts with some sweet honey, lemon, then some bananna kicks in, and finishes very tart and semi-dry. No hops detected. Metallic aftertaste. Body is light/medium, carbonation is high. Is right on for the style, however it is just not a style i care for.

Sharp, orange citrus bite with massive amounts of carbonation offering a huge head . Nice cloudy wheat inspired appearance with a pure white head that lasted thru the glass (looked like a lemon merangue pie). Pretty tangy with most the malt attributing to the wheat. Some banana-bubblegum-esque-ness to it all. Really nice and extremely satisfying on a hot day.

Pour is a bright yellow with an extremely large white head.  Aroma is a nice bananas and cream.  Flavor is a touch of wheat, a touch of clove and a touch of citrus.  Everything that you look for in the style is there but its a little light in all catagories.  Still this is slightly above par especially on a warm night.

A proper, slightly stinky wheat aroma, fruity and yeasty.  Good label, overcarbonated a bit -- the pour yielded a 10:1 white head in a pint glass.  Sunny, slightly foggy yellow.  Very effervescent, lightly tangy, dry, a bit metallic on the lips, light fruit.  Finishes quickly.  Light body.  A bit too crisp, a little too plain for me.  Goes flat quickly. Ale in the Mail selection May 2007.

12 oz bottle. The aroma reminded me of golden monkey - def strong presence of banana. The taste was ok, not as great as I thought it would be. Added a lemon, and it actually tasted better probably because of the citrus.

Bottled (Thx to Sammy for the trade). Yellow coloured. Unclear. Dense white head. Banana, yeast and sweetness in the aroma. Is light spice. Flavour of light banana, sweetness and yeast. Cloves notable. Meidum bodied. A bit citric and acidic end with a somewhat cloying bananfeeling. Not bad though.

Bottle. [Thanks to madsberg for sharing] Average fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Cloudy pale golden color. Fair lacing. Clove, yeast, banana, coriander, citrus. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Light sweet flavor with hints of acidic. Sweet finish with some citrus acidic.

Pours a cloudy yellow golden color with a medium white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves, lemon and yeast.  Taste is slightly lemony with hints of watered down banana, spices and yeast.  A refreshing warm day beer.

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Courtesy of madsberg. Pours strongly cloudy and opaque golden with a white head. Sourish, citric aroma. Fairly light in body with sour citrus notes and a touch of yeast - nothing much more really. Drinkable though. 290407

Pours a hazy gold color with a medium head, not a very good pour for a hefe. Aroma is esters; banana and citrus, low spices.  Taste is crisp, not heavy, decent carbonation but not as flavorful as others.  Lacks a distinction in flavor or aroma.  It is easy to drink.
This is a good, German style wheat beer. Nice and fruity, big head, crispy bubbly mouthfeel, overall an enjoyable brew.

From a 12oz Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy, pale golden color with a huge head of soapy white foam.  Nice head retention, with a healthy carbonation floating to the top, keeping it alive.  Clean banana yeasty notes with a creamy wheat malt base make up most of the aroma.  Simple, but satisfying.  A touch of clove phenols linger as well, but arent overbearing or too dominant.  Light bodied, highly carbonated, crisp and refreshing mouthfeel.  A little more spicy phenols present in the palate, with some nutmeg and clove making themselves a bit more prominent on the tongue.  More banana comes through as well initially, but an herbal, lemony hop finish rounds out the dry final smack.  Very satisfying example of the style.  Thanks, Tom!

Bottle courtesy of OhioDad-THANK YOU! Poured a pale golden colored. Smelled of oranges and bananas. Slightly carbonated, taste was pretty light for a hefe. Very light orange, lemon, and slight banana flavor. Pretty decent hefe!
Another outstanding brew from Victory. Light  and easy. Goes down very fast. Great on a hot day and pretty good on a cold one.

I guess I will have to try more Hefeweizens, but this was not what I expected.  Beer is light, with a larger amount of carbonation.  Taste is ok, not offensive or anything.  I just thought I would get more of a banana taste, but the flavors i got were: citrus, spice, and an over-all dryness to the beer.  It tasted more along the line of a Belgian beer to me.

Bottle via The_Epeeist, thanks Chris.   Pours a hazy straw color with a gi-normous white head.   Aroma is wheat malt, lemon, banana.  Flavor is wheat, banana, some clove and lemon, notes.   Palate is light bodied, highly carbonated, crisp and refreshing, clean yet ever so slightly spicy finish.   Very nice, great example of the style.

Bottle. Sour wheat malt, lemon and banana aroma.  Cloudy light yellow color with moderate head.    Banana, lemon, clove wheat malt flavor.   A citric acidity finish - the sharpest finish I ever had from a Hefe.   Excellent.

Bottle. Poured an hazy orange color with an large frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate sour citrus clove aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Medium sweet flavor with a medium spicy sweet finish of moderate duration. Drinkable beer.

The aroma is typical of a German Hefeweizen, though a lot more citrusy than many Ive had. Good amount of banana sweet estery notes, with lemon peel and an acidic zing. Pale golden, cloudy, with a thin white creamy lacing head. Light bodied, watery, with a fair amount of carbonation. Acidic carbonic tang with each swallow. Starts with carbonic acidity, followed by sweet banana and wheat notes. Lemony toward the finish with some mild hoppiness. Perle? Finished fairly clean with a nice crisp after, leaving small traces of banana sweetness and lemon oil. This is a pretty good American attempt at a Hefeweizen.
Light fruits and yeast in the aroma.Pours a hazy gold with a slight off white head.Slight citrus flavor.Mouthfeel is a little thin with a sweet finish.

Yeast and some very light lemon flavors.  Light yellow in color with a minimal head.  Medium to full palate for a hefe.  Nice lemon flavor up front with some yeast and light wheat flavors behind.  Really drinkable and crisp--very enjoyable.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Initially there are many ribbons of carbonation bubbles rushing to the surface which quiets down after a few minutes.  Very nice aroma of bananas, a bit yeasty, and grass.  Flavor is bananas, clove and a touch of citrus. Very easy to drink and refreshing, which I would have appreciated on a hot summer day instead of a cold winters night. Good stuff.
UPDATED: JAN 14, 2007 Tangy, citric flavor. Relatively clear blond color which looked filtered to me. No hops. Too bland for me to buy again.
Clean and crisp weissbier that is a little heavier than most because of victorys propensity to brew thicker fuller bodied beers but very enjoyable. Add a lemon on a hot day in the summer.

Pours light golden with a thin, mostly receding wispy white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, and an off note of plastic. Taste is banana, clove, sweet yeast, and citric. Finishes lightly acidic with some crisp wheat.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2007 ORIGINAL RATE: Slightly sour aroma.  Pours transparent but a just little cloudy in my steeler stein.  Barely citrusy or fruity initial taste bud hit.  Typical hefe flavor on the palate with good carbonation.  Nice finish, a teeny bit bitter but without any lingering or bitter aftertaste what so ever.

RERATE: (4/2007) Beautifully hypnotizing pour grabs your attention with those yeast clouds spinning around, lovely. Starts off clear pale yellow then goes cloudy.
